q: state Rep. Jackie Walorski , a tea party favorite who narrowly lost her race last year against Democratic Rep. Joe Donnelly in Northern Indiana, said she was excited by the prospect of Mike Pence running for governor. I think he's the clear front-runner, and I think the race is his if he chooses to accept it, Jackie Walorski said. "I think he'd clear the field." Mike Pence is from Columbus and was an attorney before running unsuccessfully for Congress against Democrat Phil Sharp in 1988 and 1990. He

"I know he feels pulled because there is a great campaign to recruit him at the federal level," she said. I'm going to be excited whatever door he picks. If Mike Pence does decide to run for president, he'll likely have to start working quickly to raise campaign money. He ended his 2010 re-election race with about$ 460,000 in his U.S. House campaign fund

"I'd like to hack his voicemail and find out what's going on in his life," Peter Capaldi told the Independent. I can't believe he didn't know what was going on. I'm an actor, what do I know? But I don't like the idea that we're ruled by people who think it's alright to hack into private phone calls. I'm glad the actors are retaliating.
